alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 07 at 4:25PM EST until November 10 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM EST TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, significant coastal flooding possible. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Miami-Dade County. * WHEN... For the Coastal Flood Statement, through late tonight. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from late tonight through Thursday evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
